page.title: 01Lowlands N.W. Of Edenbridge
page.content: The landscape of this area on the Surrey/Kent border is fairly flat, being of clay lowlands. The highest ground is on the western side at Merle Common. There are distant views of higher ridges which lie further north. It is a rural area of farmland & woods. There is some arable farming & the raising of livestock predominates. Cattle, sheep & horses are grazed in the fields. The woods are mainly of oak & beech, carpeted with bluebells in the Spring. There is a small residential area with two retail shops at Marlpit Hill, on the outskirts of Edenbridge. The hamlet of Merle Common has a first school & there are workshops & a forge. Nearby in Staffhurst Wood is the tiny St Sylvan's Church with the unusual feature of integral living accommodation for the incumbent.
